column4: hey all.  i have that dell laptop that GRUB isn't picking up on win7
i just reinstalled grub
rebooted, did the update-grub... and still no windows in the boot menu.
did you delete any partitions?
there were three.  i removed a recovery partition... maybe that was it?  that wasn't the boot partition tho, it's not where windows is installed.
i've done this before without this problem.
what model is it?
how can i fix it?  windows is still installed
inspiron n4010
fawk, seriously!??!
well, atleast that's what happened with my Inspiron 1545
oh noes.  this isn't my laptop.
well, if you have an external you could backup your stuff then reload it
hrm.  i'd really prefer to avoid that.  i think i'll try to add a manual grub entry.
so what about blowing up the mbr thru the windows recovery disc, then reinstalling grub?
that's what I meant
that didn't work?  oh man.
lol when you tried to restore win7 did it basically say you have no OSes installed?
no, I just didn't know how to do it
tell him that you can back up his data and restore it if it doesn't work
so reinstall windows, then recover GRUB?
that should work
oh yea, i'll backup his data.  thanks.
